newsitem.title: USA: Nucor to build South Carolina steel mill.
newsitem.headline: Nucor to build South Carolina steel mill.

text.p: Nucor Corp said Tuesday it plans to build a steel mill to produce up to 500,000 tons of wide-flange and bantam beams a year in Berkeley County, South Carolina.
The company said the mill will cost about $150 million and will employ up to 200 people.
The mill should start operating in late 1998, it added.
"This new steel beam mill will be an addition to Nucor's existing sheet steel mill in Berkeley County, and will be integrated with that facility's melting operations and infrastructure," it said.
Nucor makes steel products and has operating facilities in eight states.
